body: We want to adjust the docs to match the function. This change as it stands now *should* break some tests (if not then we don't have good enough test coverage).
Ah, I see. I wasn't sure which was the intended behaviour, which is why I didn't make the change myself to start with, but when prompted I went for what I considered the *expected* behaviour.

Sure, I'll do that. Before I do, though. I also noticed that _highlight_handler defaults to axis=None. Is it intentional that this has a different default to highlight_min and highlight_max? This was another part of why I originally changed the code to match the docs, rather than the other way round.

> Is it intentional that this has a different default to highlight_min and highlight_max?

"Intentional" is not necessarily the same as "logical" :smile:  I agree it is a little inconsistent, but maybe @TomAugspurger can say more.

In any case, the best thing to do here is to make the doc change, and you'll be set!
